pull.title: CMake replaces Autotools
pull.body:
This PR is based on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30454 with additional commits that delete both the Autotools-based build system and the legacy MSVC build system.

It aims reveal conflicts with other PRs.

For more details, please refer to today's IRC meeting discussion.

a non-type-specific variable.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/30664).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
A summary of reviews will appear here.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#bitcoin-core/gui/777](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/777) (getrawtransaction implementation by BrandonOdiwuor)
* [#bitcoin-core/gui/733](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/733) (Deniability - a tool to automatically improve coin ownership privacy by denavila)
* [#30661](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30661) (fuzz: Test headers pre-sync through p2p by marcofleon)
* [#30635](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30635) (rpc: add optional blockhash to waitfornewblock by Sjors)
* [#30634](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30634) (ci: Use clang-19 from apt.llvm.org by maflcko)
* [#30619](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30619) (doc: Change `nproc` in docs to `getconf _NPROCESSORS_ONLN` by paplorinc)
* [#30595](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30595) (kernel: Introduce initial C header API by TheCharlatan)
* [#30527](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30527) (Bump python minimum supported version to 3.10 by maflcko)
* [#30510](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30510) (multiprocess: Add IPC wrapper for Mining interface by ryanofsky)
* [#30509](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30509) (multiprocess: Add -ipcbind option to bitcoin-node by ryanofsky)
* [#30465](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30465) (depends: Set `CMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION` for CMake builds by hebasto)
* [#30462](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30462) (utils: replace boost::date_time usage with c++20 std::chrono by theuni)
* [#30454](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30454) (build: Introduce CMake-based build system by hebasto)
* [#30437](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30437) (multiprocess: add bitcoin-mine test program by ryanofsky)
* [#30433](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30433) (build: add `standard branch-protection` to hardening flags for aarch64-linux by fanquake)
* [#30409](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30409) (Introduce waitTipChanged() mining interface, replace RPCNotifyBlockChange and drop CRPCSignals by Sjors)
* [#30315](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30315) (Stratum v2 Transport by Sjors)
* [#30239](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30239) (Ephemeral Dust by instagibbs)
* [#30157](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30157) (Fee Estimation via Fee rate Forecasters by ismaelsadeeq)
* [#30110](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30110) (refactor: TxDownloadManager + fuzzing by glozow)
* [#30079](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30079) (Fee Estimation: Ignore all transactions that are CPFP'd by ismaelsadeeq)
* [#30075](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30075) (test, subprocess: Improve coverage report correctness by hebasto)
* [#29936](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29936) (fuzz: wallet: add target for `CreateTransaction` by brunoerg)
* [#29881](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29881) (guix: use GCC 13 to builds releases by fanquake)
* [#29868](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29868) (Reintroduce external signer support for Windows by hebasto)
* [#29852](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29852) ([WIP] build: remove need to test for endianness by fanquake)
* [#29796](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29796) ([RFC] Switch and/or align debugging flags (back) to `-Og` by fanquake)
* [#29532](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29532) (Refactor BnB tests by murchandamus)
* [#29450](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29450) (build: replace custom `MAC_OSX` macro with standard `__APPLE__` for consistent macOS detection by paplorinc)
* [#29432](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29432) (Stratum v2 Template Provider (take 3) by Sjors)
* [#29415](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29415) (Broadcast own transactions only via short-lived Tor or I2P connections by vasild)
* [#29409](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29409) (multiprocess: Add capnp wrapper for Chain interface by ryanofsky)

* [#29158](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29158) (PoC: fuzz chainstate and block managers by darosior)

* [#28792](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28792) (Embedding ASMap files as binary dump header file by fjahr)

* [#27837](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27837) (net: introduce block tracker to retry to download blocks after failure by furszy)

* [#26966](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26966) (index: initial sync speedup, parallelize process by furszy)
* [#26812](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26812) (test: add end-to-end tests for CConnman and PeerManager by vasild)
* [#26693](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26693) (build: special instruction check script by willcl-ark)
* [#26593](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26593) (tracing: Only prepare tracepoint arguments when actually tracing by 0xB10C)
* [#26334](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26334) (Add Signet launch shortcut for Windows by Sjors)
* [#26022](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26022) (Add util::ResultPtr class by ryanofsky)
* [#25665](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25665) (refactor: Add util::Result failure values, multiple error and warning messages by ryanofsky)
* [#25573](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25573) ([POC] guix: produce a fully `-static-pie` bitcoind by fanquake)
* [#24539](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24539) (Add a "tx output spender" index by sstone)
* [#24230](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24230) (indexes: Stop using node internal types and locking cs_main, improve sync logic by ryanofsky)
* [#24123](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24123) (guix: Pointer Authentication and Branch Target Identification for aarch64 Linux (Guix) by fanquake)
* [#21590](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21590) (Safegcd-based modular inverses in MuHash3072 by sipa)
* [#21283](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21283) (Implement BIP 370 PSBTv2 by achow101)
* [#19461](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19461) (multiprocess: Add bitcoin-gui -ipcconnect option by ryanofsky)
* [#19460](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19460) (multiprocess: Add bitcoin-wallet -ipcconnect option by ryanofsky)
* [#10102](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10102) (Multiprocess bitcoin by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

events.body:
<!--85328a0da195eb286784d51f73fa0af9-->
 At least one of the CI tasks failed.
<sub>Debug: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/28830258425</sub>

<details><summary>Hints</summary>

Make sure to run all tests locally, according to the documentation.

The failure may happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>
